scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters from Louis Bromfield, written from France, New York City, Long Island, and Ohio, 1928-1940, and n.d.

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, Paris, France, to Mr. Scott 1928 March 25

scopecontent.p: Thanks him for his interest in him as a writer and is flattered by his desire for the autographs

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, Malabar Farm, Lucas, Ohio, to Mr. Gilfond 1940 Oct 18

scopecontent.p: Hopes to see him in New York or Washington after Christmas

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, New York City News Association, New York, New York, to Mr. Zelie Monday night

scopecontent.p: Comments on Zelie's anecdote about chaplains saying that he himself if from Congregational and Scotch Presbyterian stock; relates that his work appears in New York papers unsigned but that his prose and efforts in verse appear signed in the Evening Postand the Times; comments on his new novel "which begins the night before the armistice and deals with the problems during the reconstruction period of a young American who was rather upset by the war and too close contact with the French philosophy and social system"

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, Cold Spring Harbor, Long Island, to W. Orton Tewson Friday

scopecontent.p: Includes verse from The Ancient Marinerand writes that one needn't go farther to "collect all the beauties imaginable in English poetry"

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield to a Chaplain Friday

scopecontent.p: Comments on the chaplain's article in the Monthlyand relates his own experiences with Frenchmen and the French army in World War I; inquires as to whether he has read Philip Gibbs' Now It Can Be Told

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, Oise, France, to Mr. [ ] n.d.

scopecontent.p: Comments on his questions concerning the greatest man alive and happiness; mentions his books The Farm, The Green Bay Tree, and [ The Strange Case of Miss] Anne Spragg

did.unittitle: Louis Bromfield, Oise, France, to Herbert [Sherman Gorman] n.d.

scopecontent.p: Explains that he has been in London where the children are in school and that he has been working in Paris and traveling when he finishes a job
